title: MRI Technologist Float
description:
Job Summary

There is a $5,000 relocation or sign on bonus for this position! RAYUS Radiology is looking for an MRI Tech to join our flex pool team. As a flex MRI Tech, you’ll travel to our outpatient centers in the Twin Cities (near you) working with a variety of team members, Radiologists, and equipment to grow your skillset. Willing to train if MRI is a modality you’re interested in learning. This position is fulltime working a variety of shifts between the hours of 6:30am-10:30pm, includes differential pay and mileage for this role (no call). Part-time (30-39 hours per week, benefit eligible) is also available.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

(75%) Patient Imaging
• Performs routine and advanced MRI procedures on designated portions of the body for use by physicians in the diagnosing and treating of patient illness and/or injury with minimal amount of supervision or repeats
• Screens patient before exam for any precautions or contraindications pertaining to the examination
• Prepares patients for MR procedures that will be performed, explaining the procedure, position patients so that the parts of the body can be appropriately scanned, and providing patient support by talking to patients throughout procedure
• Adjusts scan parameters correctly and as needed
• Maintains positive attitude and working relationships with radiologist, referring customers and other associates and peers
• Converses with doctors, nurses, patients and family members as required.
• Follows physicians' orders precisely and conforms to safety regulations to protect themselves, their patients, and coworkers
• Accurately maintains patient records within Radiology Information System (RIS)
• Maintains an orderly and clean work area promoting good safety habits for patients and co-workers

(20%) Imaging Support
• Maintains equipment in good working order; cleans and disinfects equipment after each use
• Assists with maintaining an updated MRI protocol manual and software upgrades
• Monitors medical supply inventory
• Assists with training of new associates, providing resource and technical expertise

(5%) Performs other duties as assigned

Requirements

Required:
• ARMRIT or ARRT registered technologist, current and in good standing
• Graduate of the American Medical Association (AMA) approved school of radiography licensed Radiological Technologist in the appropriate state, if applicable
• Current Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) certification
• Valid driver's license and proof of current insurance

Preferred:
• MR certification
• Bilingual

RAYUS is committed to delivering clinical excellence in communities across the U.S., driven by our passion for and superior service to referring providers and patients. RAYUS Radiology is built on our brilliant medicine, brilliant team, brilliant technology and services—all to provide the highest level of patient care possible.

We bring brilliance to health and wellness. Join our team and shine the light on Radiology Services!

RAYUS Radiology is an EO Employer/Vets/Disabled.

#LI-JH1

title: MRI Technologist
description:
About the position

The MRI Technologist position at Allina Health involves performing and assisting with Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) procedures under the direction of a radiologist. The role focuses on providing timely and quality services to patients while ensuring a safe and efficient environment. The position is based at the Eden Prairie Clinic, which is expanding and offers a variety of specialty clinics and an imaging department. This role includes a signing bonus for eligible external talent and does not require weekend or holiday rotations.

Responsibilities
• Completes procedures in compliance with physician orders and department guidelines.
,
• Identifies patient with two identifiers.
,
• Documents accurately all needed aspects of the procedure.
,
• Observes and communicates with patient, responding to needs.
,
• Maintains safe patient environment in procedure area.
,
• Performs procedures with high degree of accuracy.
,
• Demonstrates appropriate knowledge of all diagnostic equipment.
,
• Maintains work knowledge and competence.
,
• Gathers all relevant information to assist in interpretation of images.
,
• Verifies all imaging has appropriately transferred to imaging storage and retrieval system.
,
• Provides accurate clerical function using Excellian (electronic medical record).
,
• Understands the Enterprise Medical Imaging/Picture Archiving and Communication System.
,
• Ensures all documentation is complete post procedure.
,
• Communicates with Supervisor and team, reporting problems, issues or ideas.
,
• Provides assistance, ideas and information to support the work of others.

Requirements
• Vocational or Technical Training graduate of accredited School of Radiologic Technology.
,
• Registered Technologist - The American Registry of Radiologic Technologists (ARRT) required.
,
• MRI certification with ARRT preferred upon hire.
,
• BLS Tier 1 - Basic Life Support - Multisource required upon hire.

Nice-to-haves
• 0 to 2 years of MRI experience.

Benefits
• $7,500 signing bonus for eligible external talent.

title: MR Technologist
description:
Job Summary

There is a $3,000 relocation or sign on bonus for this role! RAYUS Radiology looking for an MRI Technologist to join our team. As an MRI Technologist, you will operate your assigned scanner(s) to produce images of the patient's body for diagnostic purposes. Taking a patient centered approach, you will provide MRI services within professional standards and with excellent customer service. Each patient comes to our centers looking for answers. You will guide patients through this sometimes difficult process by kindly talking them through the steps and answering their questions and concerns regarding exam procedures and process.

This position is fulltime working Monday-Friday from 1:00pm-9:30pm, includes weekend rotation (no call). This position is also available part-time 30-39 hours/week, benefit eligible. Willing to train in MRI!

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

(90%) Patient MRI Imaging
• A screening process is implemented to assess the patient for any precautions or contradictions that could impact the examination, with the use of two patient identifiers to ascertain the correct individual and procedure
• Explains and prepares patients for MRI procedures that will be performed, explaining the procedure, positioning patients so that the parts of the body can be appropriately
• Executes standard and complex MRI examinations on specified anatomical regions to aid physicians in diagnosing and treating patient illnesses and injuries with little supervision or repetition of scans, while delivering verbal reassurance to patients to ensure their comfort during the procedure
• Changes MRI imaging parameters suitably and in line with specifications
• Ensures a positive attitude and fosters positive working relationships with radiologists, clients, and colleagues
• Adhere strictly to physicians' directives and comply with safety regulations to safeguard your well-being, patients, and coworkers
• Maintains the integrity of patient information in the Radiology Information System (RIS)
• Supports safety protocols by keeping the workspace orderly and clean for the well-being of patients and co-workers
• Enforces the ACR toolkit framework and accreditation obligations
• Keeps equipment in working condition; sterilizes equipment following every use
• Maintains strict adherence to HIPAA guidelines to ensure compliance

(5%) MRI Department Support
• Assists with the upkeep of an imaging protocol manual and upgrading software when necessary
• Supervises the medical supply stock and requests additional items as appropriate
• Provides assistance in the training of new team members, offering expertise and resources as required

(5%) Completes other tasks as assigned

Requirements

Required:
• ARMRIT or ARRT registered technologist, current and in good standing
• Graduate of the American Medical Association (AMA) approved school of radiography
• Licensed Radiological Technologist in the appropriate state, if applicable
• Current Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) certification

Preferred:
• Certification in imaging specialty
• Bilingual

RAYUS is committed to delivering clinical excellence in communities across the U.S., driven by our passion for and superior service to referring providers and patients. RAYUS Radiology is built on our brilliant medicine, brilliant team, brilliant technology and services - all to provide the highest level of patient care possible.

Let's work together to bring brilliance to the realm of health and wellness. Join our team and illuminate the value of Radiology Services!

RAYUS Radiology promotes an inclusive work environment, embracing veterans and individuals with disabilities.

#LI-JH1

title: MR Technologist Float
description:
Job Summary

RAYUS now offers DailyPay! Work today, get paid today!

RAYUS Radiology, formerly Center for Diagnostic Imaging, is looking for a Float MRI Technologist to join our team. As a Float MRI Technologist, you will operate an MRI scanner to produce images of the patient's body for diagnostic purposes at multiple centers within the market. Provides leadership and technical support to MRI services, assuring that services are provided within professional standards and with excellent customer service. Remains self-motivated to increase level of understanding and knowledge of the field, disease, and new procedures as they evolve. This is a full-time position working in Burnsville, Lakeville, and Eagan; day and evening shifts; includes weekend rotation (no call).

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

(75%) Patient Imaging
• Performs routine and advanced MRI procedures on designated portions of the body for use by physicians in the diagnosing and treating of patient illness and/or injury with minimal amount of supervision or repeats
• Screens patient before exam for any precautions or contraindications pertaining to the examination
• Prepares patients for MR procedures that will be performed, explaining the procedure, position patients so that the parts of the body can be appropriately scanned, and providing patient support by talking to patients throughout procedure
• Adjusts scan parameters correctly and as needed
• Maintains positive attitude and working relationships with radiologist, referring customers and other associates and peers
• Converses with doctors, nurses, patients and family members as required
• Follows physicians' orders precisely and conforms to safety regulations to protect themselves, their patients, and coworkers
• Accurately maintains patient records within Radiology Information System (RIS)
• Maintains an orderly and clean work area promoting good safety habits for patients and co-workers

(20%) Imaging Support
• Maintains equipment in good working order; cleans and disinfects equipment after each use
• Assists with maintaining an updated MRI protocol manual and software upgrades
• Monitors medical supply inventory
• Assists with training of new associates, providing resource and technical expertise

(5%) Performs other duties as assigned

Remote Position

No

Status

Full-time

Requirements

Required:
• ARRT registered technologist, current and in good standing
• Graduate of the American Medical Association (AMA) approved school of radiography Licensed Radiological Technologist in the appropriate state, if applicable
• Current Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) certification
• Must have training and experience sufficient to competently perform MR and/or radiographic procedures independently
• Valid driver's license and proof of current insurance

Preferred:
• MR certification
• Bilingual

RAYUS is committed to delivering clinical excellence in communities across the U.S., driven by our passion for and superior service to referring providers and patients. RAYUS Radiology is built on our brilliant medicine, brilliant team, brilliant technology and services - all to provide the highest level of patient care possible.

We bring brilliance to health and wellness. Join our team and shine the light on Radiology Services!
RAYUS Radiology is an EO Employer/Vets/Disabled.

#LI-JH1

title: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Technician
description:
Additional Duties
• Department Support: Assist with maintaining updated imaging protocols, monitoring medical supply inventory, and training new associates.
• Quality Assurance: Ensure compliance with safety regulations, maintain a clean work area, and adhere to HIPAA guidelines.

title: MRI Technologist, Clinic
description:
Job Description

Park Nicollet is looking to hire an MRI Technologist to join our Radiology team! Come join us as a Partner for Good and help us make an impact on the care and experience that our patients and their families receive every day.

Position Summary

Park Nicollet Radiology team members partner with providers to ensure that each patient has a safe, caring experience. We value teamwork and partnering because it promotes safety, quality, and caring for everyone we work with. Working the Park Nicollet Radiology means you make a difference every single day! Performs high quality and accurate diagnostic Magnetic Resonance Imaging in accordance with established protocols. Interacts with patients, clinicians, and staff in a professional and courteous manner. Applies knowledge ofMRI safety, emergency protocols and procedures. Performs tasks to comply with regulatory standards. Educates and trains others on the operation of all MRI equipment, procedures, image quality, and exposure techniques.

Work Schedule

Fulltime 1.0 FTE. Days/Evenings, weekends, holidays, call.

Required Qualifications

Licensure/ Registration/ Certification:

American Registry of Radiologic Technologist (ARRT) registry is required and must be maintained.

Advanced Registry in Magnetic Resonance required within 12 months after first shift working solo within modality.

Must maintain ARRT (R)(MR)

In lieu of ARRT (R) requirement, an ultrasound or nuclear medicine certification may be considered based on business need.

Must obtain certification of BLS within 6 months and continuously maintain.

Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities

Problem solving skills and discretion with patient information is also required.

Computer knowledge or experience in specialized imaging systems such as three-dimensional reconstruction is required.

The ability to exercise good judgment is important.

Must exhibit strong interpersonal and team building skills.

Demonstrates knowledge of age-related growth and development principles necessary to provide appropriate service and assure safety of patients.

For MRI specialty positions (Cardiac, Breast, Prostate, 3T) experience in the specialty areas is preferred. If all other qualifications are met, an applicant with specialty experience may be selected over technologists without that experience.

Must possess the ability to operate the following pieces of equipment safely and efficiently: Patient Transfer Devices, Security System, Fire Alarms, Three Dimensional Workstations, Emergency Equipment, Power Injector, PC, printer, voice documentation devices, fax and photocopier. Proficient in EMR processes, and PACS.

Must be willing to train and maintain competency in the operation of new equipment and technology.

Preferred Qualifications

Education, Experience or Equivalent Combination:

Benefits

Additional specialized training or experience in MRI is preferred.

Park Nicollet offers a competitive benefits package (for eligible positions) that includes medical insurance, dental insurance, a retirement program, time away from work, insurance options, tuition reimbursement, an employee assistance program, onsite clinic and much more!

title: MRI Technologist - Evenings - Up to $70/hr
description:
MRI Technologist- Evenings- Eagan, MN

Professionally develop and enhance your healthcare career at Interim Healthcare Staffing! Gain valuable, industry leading experience working in one of our many specialty areas. Interim Healthcare Staffing offers amazing opportunities for career progression, as well as ongoing education and development programs.

Schedule/Shifts: Temporary Full-Time assignment, M-F 2:00pm - 10:30pm.

Location: Clinic setting in Eagan, MN.

Pay rate: Up to $70, depending on experience!
• This is a temporary assignment expected to last around 13 weeks with the opportunity to extend or become permanent!

What we offer you:
• Locally Owned and Operated Business
• Opportunity to work different locations/Diversity in clinic settings
• Free Education Courses
• Competitive Salary and Benefits
• Health Coverage
• Dental Coverage
• PTO Accrual Based on Hours Worked

What we ask of you:
• Screen patients before exam for any precautions or contradictions pertaining to the examination.
• Prepares patients for MRI procedures, explaining the procedure, and positioning patient's body parts appropriately.
• Perform routine and advanced MRI procedures on designated portions of the body used by physicians to diagnose and treat a patient's illness/injury with minimal supervision while providing patient support throughout the procedure. Adjust MRI scan parameters and dose reduction techniques as needed.
• Maintain a positive attitude and working relationships with radiology team, follow physician instructions precisely, and accurately maintain patient records within Radiology Information System (RIS).
• Maintain a clean work area promoting good safety habits for patients and co-workers, and maintain equipment in good working order, clean and disinfect after each use.
• Maintain ACR toolkit and accreditation requirements, and ensure compliance with all HIPAA guidelines.
• Assist with maintaining an updated MRI protocol manual and software upgrades, and monitor medical supply inventory and request supplies as necessary.
• All other duties as assigned.

What we require of you:
• ARRT certification, current and in good standing.
• Graduate of an American Medical Association (AMA) approved school of radiography.
• Current Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) certification.
• Experience and comfort utilizing MRI equipment/techniques, experience with Siemens or Hitachi scanners preferred.
• MRI certification is preferred.
• Bilingual preferred but not required.

Who we are:

Interim HealthCare is America's leading provider of healthcare staffing. We offer one of the most comprehensive selections of career opportunities in the industry ranging from per diem to full-time.

If you're looking for a stable career opportunity, look no further. We offer the security of working for an established company. Nationally, Interim HealthCare has been providing great jobs to great people for over 50 years and there are more than 300 offices across the country. That kind of stability combined with our commitment to integrity makes us your perfect career partner.

Interim HealthCare is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Each Interim HealthCare location is independently owned and operated. ©2019 Interim HealthCare Inc.

• Experience and comfort utilizing MRI equipment/techniques, experience with Siemens or Hitachi scanners preferred.
• MRI certification is preferred.
• Bilingual preferred but not required.

Who we are:

Interim HealthCare is America's leading provider of healthcare staffing. We offer one of the most comprehensive selections of career opportunities in the industry ranging from per diem to full-time.

If you're looking for a stable career opportunity, look no further. We offer the security of working for an established company. Nationally, Interim HealthCare has been providing great jobs to great people for over 50 years and there are more than 300 offices across the country. That kind of stability combined with our commitment to integrity makes us your perfect career partner.

Interim HealthCare is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Each Interim HealthCare location is independently owned and operated. ©2019 Interim HealthCare Inc.

title: MRI Technologist Float
description:
Job Summary

There is a $5,000 relocation or sign on bonus for this position! RAYUS Radiology is looking for an MRI Tech to join our flex pool team. As a flex MRI Tech, you’ll travel to our outpatient centers in the Twin Cities (near you) working with a variety of team members, Radiologists, and equipment to grow your skillset. Willing to train if MRI is a modality you’re interested in learning. This position is fulltime working a variety of shifts between the hours of 6:30am-10:30pm, includes differential pay and mileage for this role (no call). Part-time (30-39 hours per week, benefit eligible) is also available.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

(75%) Patient Imaging
• Performs routine and advanced MRI procedures on designated portions of the body for use by physicians in the diagnosing and treating of patient illness and/or injury with minimal amount of supervision or repeats
• Screens patient before exam for any precautions or contraindications pertaining to the examination
• Prepares patients for MR procedures that will be performed, explaining the procedure, position patients so that the parts of the body can be appropriately scanned, and providing patient support by talking to patients throughout procedure
• Adjusts scan parameters correctly and as needed
• Maintains positive attitude and working relationships with radiologist, referring customers and other associates and peers
• Converses with doctors, nurses, patients and family members as required.
• Follows physicians' orders precisely and conforms to safety regulations to protect themselves, their patients, and coworkers
• Accurately maintains patient records within Radiology Information System (RIS)
• Maintains an orderly and clean work area promoting good safety habits for patients and co-workers

(20%) Imaging Support
• Maintains equipment in good working order; cleans and disinfects equipment after each use
• Assists with maintaining an updated MRI protocol manual and software upgrades
• Monitors medical supply inventory
• Assists with training of new associates, providing resource and technical expertise

(5%) Performs other duties as assigned

Requirements

Required:
• ARMRIT or ARRT registered technologist, current and in good standing
• Graduate of the American Medical Association (AMA) approved school of radiography licensed Radiological Technologist in the appropriate state, if applicable
• Current Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) certification
• Valid driver's license and proof of current insurance

Preferred:
• MR certification
• Bilingual

RAYUS is committed to delivering clinical excellence in communities across the U.S., driven by our passion for and superior service to referring providers and patients. RAYUS Radiology is built on our brilliant medicine, brilliant team, brilliant technology and services—all to provide the highest level of patient care possible.

We bring brilliance to health and wellness. Join our team and shine the light on Radiology Services!

#LI-JH1

title: MRI Technologist
description:
About the position

The MRI Technologist position at Allina Health involves performing and assisting with Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) procedures under the direction of a radiologist. The role focuses on providing timely and quality services to patients while ensuring a safe and efficient environment. The position is based at the Eden Prairie Clinic, which is expanding and offers a variety of specialty clinics and an imaging department. This role includes a signing bonus for eligible external talent and does not require weekend or holiday rotations.

Responsibilities
• Completes procedures in compliance with physician orders and department guidelines.
,
• Identifies patient with two identifiers.
,
• Documents accurately all needed aspects of the procedure.
,
• Observes and communicates with patient, responding to needs.
,
• Maintains safe patient environment in procedure area.
,
• Performs procedures with high degree of accuracy.
,
• Demonstrates appropriate knowledge of all diagnostic equipment.
,
• Maintains work knowledge and competence.
,
• Gathers all relevant information to assist in interpretation of images.
,
• Verifies all imaging has appropriately transferred to imaging storage and retrieval system.
,
• Provides accurate clerical function using Excellian (electronic medical record).
,
• Understands the Enterprise Medical Imaging/Picture Archiving and Communication System.
,
• Ensures all documentation is complete post procedure.
,
• Communicates with Supervisor and team, reporting problems, issues or ideas.
,
• Provides assistance, ideas and information to support the work of others.

Requirements
• Vocational or Technical Training graduate of accredited School of Radiologic Technology.
,
• Registered Technologist - The American Registry of Radiologic Technologists (ARRT) required.
,
• MRI certification with ARRT preferred upon hire.
,
• BLS Tier 1 - Basic Life Support - Multisource required upon hire.

Nice-to-haves
• 0 to 2 years of MRI experience.

Benefits
• $7,500 signing bonus for eligible external talent.

title: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Technician
description:
Additional Duties
• Department Support: Assist with maintaining updated imaging protocols, monitoring medical supply inventory, and training new associates.
• Quality Assurance: Ensure compliance with safety regulations, maintain a clean work area, and adhere to HIPAA guidelines.

title: MR Technologist
description:
Job Summary

There is a $3,000 relocation or sign on bonus for this role! RAYUS Radiology looking for an MRI Technologist to join our team. As an MRI Technologist, you will operate your assigned scanner(s) to produce images of the patient's body for diagnostic purposes. Taking a patient centered approach, you will provide MRI services within professional standards and with excellent customer service. Each patient comes to our centers looking for answers. You will guide patients through this sometimes difficult process by kindly talking them through the steps and answering their questions and concerns regarding exam procedures and process.

This position is fulltime working Monday-Friday from 1:00pm-9:30pm, includes weekend rotation (no call). This position is also available part-time 30-39 hours/week, benefit eligible. Willing to train in MRI!

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

(90%) Patient MRI Imaging
• A screening process is implemented to assess the patient for any precautions or contradictions that could impact the examination, with the use of two patient identifiers to ascertain the correct individual and procedure
• Explains and prepares patients for MRI procedures that will be performed, explaining the procedure, positioning patients so that the parts of the body can be appropriately
• Executes standard and complex MRI examinations on specified anatomical regions to aid physicians in diagnosing and treating patient illnesses and injuries with little supervision or repetition of scans, while delivering verbal reassurance to patients to ensure their comfort during the procedure
• Changes MRI imaging parameters suitably and in line with specifications
• Ensures a positive attitude and fosters positive working relationships with radiologists, clients, and colleagues
• Adhere strictly to physicians' directives and comply with safety regulations to safeguard your well-being, patients, and coworkers
• Maintains the integrity of patient information in the Radiology Information System (RIS)
• Supports safety protocols by keeping the workspace orderly and clean for the well-being of patients and co-workers
• Enforces the ACR toolkit framework and accreditation obligations
• Keeps equipment in working condition; sterilizes equipment following every use
• Maintains strict adherence to HIPAA guidelines to ensure compliance

(5%) MRI Department Support
• Assists with the upkeep of an imaging protocol manual and upgrading software when necessary
• Supervises the medical supply stock and requests additional items as appropriate
• Provides assistance in the training of new team members, offering expertise and resources as required

(5%) Completes other tasks as assigned

Requirements

Required:
• ARMRIT or ARRT registered technologist, current and in good standing
• Graduate of the American Medical Association (AMA) approved school of radiography
• Licensed Radiological Technologist in the appropriate state, if applicable
• Current Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) certification

Preferred:
• Certification in imaging specialty
• Bilingual

RAYUS is committed to delivering clinical excellence in communities across the U.S., driven by our passion for and superior service to referring providers and patients. RAYUS Radiology is built on our brilliant medicine, brilliant team, brilliant technology and services - all to provide the highest level of patient care possible.

Let's work together to bring brilliance to the realm of health and wellness. Join our team and illuminate the value of Radiology Services!

RAYUS Radiology promotes an inclusive work environment, embracing veterans and individuals with disabilities.

title: Medical Imaging Specialist
description:
Company Overview
">

RAYUS Radiology is a leading provider of diagnostic imaging services, dedicated to delivering high-quality patient care and exceptional customer service.
">

Salary
">

The pay range for this position is $28.71-$44.86 based on direct and relevant experience.
">

Job Description
">

We are seeking a skilled CT Technologist to join our team of medical professionals. As a CT Technologist at RAYUS Radiology, you will operate CT scanners to produce diagnostic images while ensuring a patient-centered approach.
">
• Guide patients through imaging procedures, maintaining positive relationships with medical staff.
• Ensure compliance with safety and HIPAA regulations.
• Operate assigned scanner(s) to produce images of the patient's body for diagnostic purposes.
• Provide scanning services within professional standards and with excellent customer service.
">

Required Skills and Qualifications
">

To be successful in this role, you will need:
">
• Able to work flexible day shifts, including occasional evening or weekend hours.
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with ability to interact effectively with patients, medical staff, and colleagues.
• Familiarity with CT scanning technology and medical imaging principles.
• Demonstrated ability to work accurately and efficiently in a fast-paced environment.
">

Benefits
">

We offer a comprehensive benefits package, including:
">
• Competitive salary and bonus structure.
• Opportunities for career advancement and professional growth.
• Flexible scheduling to accommodate your needs.
• A supportive and collaborative work environment.
">

Others
">

This is a casual position working day shifts, flexible schedule. We are committed to providing exceptional patient care and exceeding customer expectations. If you are passionate about delivering high-quality medical imaging services and possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills, we encourage you to apply.

title: MRI Technologist, Clinic
description:
Job Description

Park Nicollet is looking to hire an MRI Technologist to join our Radiology team! Come join us as a Partner for Good and help us make an impact on the care and experience that our patients and their families receive every day.

Position Summary

Park Nicollet Radiology team members partner with providers to ensure that each patient has a safe, caring experience. We value teamwork and partnering because it promotes safety, quality, and caring for everyone we work with. Working the Park Nicollet Radiology means you make a difference every single day! Performs high quality and accurate diagnostic Magnetic Resonance Imaging in accordance with established protocols. Interacts with patients, clinicians, and staff in a professional and courteous manner. Applies knowledge ofMRI safety, emergency protocols and procedures. Performs tasks to comply with regulatory standards. Educates and trains others on the operation of all MRI equipment, procedures, image quality, and exposure techniques.

Work Schedule

Fulltime 1.0 FTE. Days/Evenings, weekends, holidays, call.

Required Qualifications

Licensure/ Registration/ Certification:

American Registry of Radiologic Technologist (ARRT) registry is required and must be maintained.

Advanced Registry in Magnetic Resonance required within 12 months after first shift working solo within modality.

Must maintain ARRT (R)(MR)

In lieu of ARRT (R) requirement, an ultrasound or nuclear medicine certification may be considered based on business need.

Must obtain certification of BLS within 6 months and continuously maintain.

Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities

Problem solving skills and discretion with patient information is also required.

Computer knowledge or experience in specialized imaging systems such as three-dimensional reconstruction is required.

The ability to exercise good judgment is important.

Must exhibit strong interpersonal and team building skills.

Demonstrates knowledge of age-related growth and development principles necessary to provide appropriate service and assure safety of patients.

For MRI specialty positions (Cardiac, Breast, Prostate, 3T) experience in the specialty areas is preferred. If all other qualifications are met, an applicant with specialty experience may be selected over technologists without that experience.

Must possess the ability to operate the following pieces of equipment safely and efficiently: Patient Transfer Devices, Security System, Fire Alarms, Three Dimensional Workstations, Emergency Equipment, Power Injector, PC, printer, voice documentation devices, fax and photocopier. Proficient in EMR processes, and PACS.

Must be willing to train and maintain competency in the operation of new equipment and technology.

Preferred Qualifications

Education, Experience or Equivalent Combination:

Benefits

Additional specialized training or experience in MRI is preferred.

Park Nicollet offers a competitive benefits package (for eligible positions) that includes medical insurance, dental insurance, a retirement program, time away from work, insurance options, tuition reimbursement, an employee assistance program, onsite clinic and much more!

title: Radiology Imaging Technician
description:
Our Values

At RAYUS Radiology, we value integrity, compassion, and excellence in all that we do.
Job Description:

The successful candidate will be responsible for producing high-quality images, providing excellent customer service, and maintaining a safe and clean work environment.
Key Responsibilities:
• Operate scanning equipment to produce diagnostic images of patients' bodies.
• Explain procedures to patients, ensuring they understand what to expect during the exam.
• Maintain compliance with safety regulations, protecting patients, staff, and equipment.
